recipe.title: Mediterranean Chicken Pita
recipe.description: Flavorful pita with Mediterranean ingredients
instructions: Season chicken with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook chicken for 8-10 minutes until done.
Warm pita breads in microwave or on stovetop.
Cut pitas in half to form pockets.
Fill with chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, and onion.
Top with feta and tzatziki sauce.

recipe.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Berries
recipe.description: Quick and easy breakfast with balanced carbs and protein
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer half of the Greek yogurt.
Add half of the berries and half of the granola.
Repeat layers with remaining yogurt, berries, and granola.
Top with chia seeds and drizzle with honey.
Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Spinach and Cheese Omelet
recipe.description: Fluffy omelet packed with nutrients and protein
instructions: Beat eggs with water, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute. Remove and set aside.
Pour egg mixture into the pan, tilting to spread evenly.
Cook until edges set, about 2 minutes.
Add spinach and cheese to one half of the omelet.
Fold omelet in half and cook 1 more minute.
Slide onto plate and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Whole Wheat Pancakes with Berry Compote
recipe.description: Weekend breakfast with controlled portions and fiber
instructions: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk egg, milk, and oil.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients, stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form and edges set, flip and cook 1-2 minutes more.
For compote, heat berries with water in a small pan until softened.
Serve pancakes topped with warm berry compote.

recipe.title: Veggie Egg Scramble with Whole Wheat Toast
recipe.description: Protein-rich breakfast with fiber from vegetables and whole grains
instructions: Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add onions and bell peppers, sauté for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.
Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Pour egg mixture into pan with vegetables.
Gently scramble eggs until just set, about 3-4 minutes.
Toast whole wheat bread and serve alongside scrambled eggs.

recipe.title: Overnight Oats with Almonds
recipe.description: Make-ahead breakfast with slow-releasing carbs
instructions: In a jar or container, combine oats, almond milk, almond butter, flaxseed, and cinnamon.
Stir well to combine all ingredients.
Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours.
In the morning, top with blueberries and sliced almonds.
Enjoy cold or warmed up in the microwave.

recipe.title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
recipe.description: Trendy breakfast with healthy fats and protein
instructions: Toast the bread until golden brown.
While bread toasts, bring a pot of water to gentle simmer.
Create a whirlpool in water and drop egg into center.
Poach egg for 3-4 minutes until white is set but yolk is runny.
Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread avocado mixture on toast.
Top with poached egg and sprinkle with red pepper flakes.

recipe.title: Cottage Cheese Bowl with Fruit
recipe.description: High-protein breakfast with fresh fruit
instructions: Place cottage cheese in a bowl.
Arrange peaches and blueberries on top.
Sprinkle with walnuts and cinnamon.
Drizzle with honey.
Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Turkey Sausage Breakfast Wrap
recipe.description: Portable breakfast with lean protein
instructions: Cook turkey sausage in a skillet until browned, breaking into crumbles.
Remove sausage and set aside.
Scramble eggs in the same skillet with olive oil.
Warm tortillas in microwave for 20 seconds.
Divide sausage, eggs, cheese, and spinach between tortillas.
Top with salsa and roll up tightly.
Cut in half and serve warm.

recipe.title: Breakfast Quinoa with Berries
recipe.description: Protein-packed alternative to oatmeal
instructions: Rinse quinoa under cold water.
In a saucepan, combine quinoa, almond milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and divide into bowls.
Top with berries, almonds, and maple syrup.

recipe.title: Baked Egg Cups with Vegetables
recipe.description: Make-ahead individual egg portions
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and spray muffin tin with cooking spray.
Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Divide vegetables evenly among 6 muffin cups.
Pour egg mixture over vegetables.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until eggs are set.
Cool slightly before removing from tin.

recipe.title: Chia Pudding with Mango
recipe.description: Creamy make-ahead breakfast with omega-3s
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together chia seeds, coconut milk, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Let sit for 5 minutes, then whisk again to break up clumps.
Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours.
Divide into serving bowls.
Top with mango and toasted coconut.

recipe.title: Zucchini Bread Oatmeal
recipe.description: Vegetables hidden in a comforting breakfast
instructions: Bring water to boil in a small saucepan.
Add oats and reduce heat to simmer.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add grated zucchini, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Cook 2-3 more minutes until oats are creamy.
Transfer to bowl and top with walnuts and maple syrup.

recipe.title: Smoked Salmon Bagel Thin
recipe.description: Light version of classic breakfast with omega-3s
instructions: Toast bagel thin until golden.
Spread cream cheese on both halves.
Layer salmon, tomato, and onion on bottom half.
Sprinkle with capers and dill.
Top with other bagel half or serve open-faced.

recipe.title: Protein Power Smoothie
recipe.description: Quick breakfast drink with hidden vegetables
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add more almond milk if needed for desired consistency.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.

recipe.title: Grilled Chicken Salad with Quinoa
recipe.description: Protein-packed salad with whole grains
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions and let cool.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest, then slice.
In a large bowl, combine greens, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion.
Add cooled quinoa and toss.
Whisk olive oil and lemon juice for dressing.
Top salad with sliced chicken and drizzle with dressing.

recipe.title: Sweet Potato Hash with Eggs
recipe.description: Colorful breakfast skillet with complex carbs
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add sweet potato and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add bell pepper and onion, cook 5 more minutes.
Season with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Make two wells in the hash and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook until eggs are set to desired doneness.
Serve hot from the skillet.

recipe.title: Tuna Salad on Whole Grain Crackers
recipe.description: Light lunch with omega-3 fatty acids
instructions: Drain tuna and place in a bowl.
Mix in Greek yogurt, mayo, celery, onion, and relish.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve tuna salad with crackers and baby carrots.
Can be stored in refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipe.title: Lentil Vegetable Soup
recipe.description: Hearty soup packed with fiber and protein
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion, carrots, and celery for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cumin, cook 1 minute more.
Add lentils, broth, and tomatoes.
Bring to boil, then simmer for 20-25 minutes until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach during last 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe.title: Turkey and Avocado Wrap
recipe.description: Quick and satisfying lunch wrap
instructions: Lay tortilla flat and spread hummus and mustard.
Layer turkey slices in the center.
Add avocado, lettuce, and tomato.
Roll tightly, tucking in sides as you go.
Cut in half diagonally and serve.

recipe.title: Chickpea Buddha Bowl
recipe.description: Colorful plant-based bowl with roasted chickpeas
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Roast chickpeas for 20-25 minutes until crispy.
Massage kale with a pinch of salt until softened.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with kale, roasted chickpeas, sweet potato, and cabbage.
Mix tahini with lemon juice and water for dressing.
Drizzle dressing over bowls.

recipe.title: Black Bean and Rice Bowl
recipe.description: Simple and satisfying plant-based meal
instructions: Heat black beans with cumin in a small pot.
In a skillet, sauté bell pepper and corn in olive oil for 5 minutes.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with black beans, sautéed vegetables, and onion.
Drizzle with lime juice and garnish with cilantro and avocado.

recipe.title: Egg Salad Sandwich
recipe.description: Classic lunch with a healthy twist
instructions: Peel and chop hard-boiled eggs.
Mix eggs with Greek yogurt, mayo, and mustard.
Stir in celery and season with salt and pepper.
Toast bread if desired.
Spread egg salad on two slices of bread.
Top with lettuce and tomato.
Close sandwiches and cut in half.

recipe.title: Salmon and Spinach Salad
recipe.description: Omega-3 rich salad with baked salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Season salmon with salt and pepper.
Bake salmon for 12-15 minutes until flaky.
Mix spinach, strawberries, and pecans in a bowl.
Whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and honey.
Flake salmon over salad.
Crumble goat cheese on top and drizzle with dressing.

recipe.title: Minestrone Soup
recipe.description: Italian vegetable soup with beans and pasta
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté carrots, celery, and zucchini for 5 minutes.
Add broth, tomatoes, beans, and Italian seasoning.
Bring to boil, then add pasta.
Simmer for 10-12 minutes until pasta is tender.
Stir in spinach during last 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe.title: Veggie Quesadilla
recipe.description: Cheesy vegetarian quesadilla with whole wheat tortilla
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Sauté peppers and onions for 3-4 minutes.
Spread mashed black beans on half of tortilla.
Top with sautéed vegetables, spinach, and cheese.
Fold tortilla in half.
Cook in skillet for 2-3 minutes per side until golden.
Cut into wedges and serve with salsa.

recipe.title: Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps
recipe.description: Light and crunchy wraps with Asian flavors
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook ground chicken, breaking it up, for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute.
Stir in water chestnuts, soy sauce, and rice vinegar.
Cook 2-3 more minutes until heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in green onions.
Spoon mixture into lettuce leaves and serve.

recipe.title: Turkey Meatball Sub
recipe.description: Healthier version of classic meatball sub
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Mix turkey, breadcrumbs, egg, garlic, and Italian seasoning.
Form into 8 small meatballs.
Place on baking sheet and bake for 15-18 minutes.
Heat marinara sauce in a pot.
Add cooked meatballs to sauce.
Split sub rolls and fill with meatballs and sauce.
Top with mozzarella and broil for 2 minutes until melted.

recipe.title: Baked Cod with Roasted Vegetables
recipe.description: Light and healthy dinner with lean protein
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toss vegetables with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread on baking sheet and roast for 15 minutes.
Season cod with herbs, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Push vegetables to sides and place cod in center.
Drizzle with remaining oil and lemon juice.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Serve with brown rice.

recipe.title: Shrimp and Avocado Salad
recipe.description: Light and refreshing salad with protein
instructions: Season shrimp with chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side until pink.
In a large bowl, combine greens, tomatoes, and cucumber.
Top with cooked shrimp and avocado slices.
Drizzle with lime juice and garnish with cilantro.

recipe.title: Turkey Chili with Beans
recipe.description: Hearty and warming chili packed with protein
instructions: Brown ground turkey in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and bell pepper, cook 5 minutes.
Stir in chili powder and cumin, cook 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, beans, and broth.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with optional toppings.

recipe.title: Grilled Chicken with Sweet Potato
recipe.description: Balanced meal with lean protein and complex carbs
instructions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high.
Cut sweet potato into 1/2-inch rounds.
Brush potato and chicken with olive oil.
Season chicken with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken 6-7 minutes per side until cooked.
Grill sweet potato slices 4-5 minutes per side.
Steam green beans for 5 minutes until tender.
Serve chicken with sweet potato and green beans.

recipe.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipe.description: Colorful peppers filled with quinoa and vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds.
Heat olive oil and sauté onion for 3 minutes.
Mix quinoa, beans, corn, tomatoes, onion, and cumin.
Stuff peppers with quinoa mixture.
Place in baking dish with 1/4 cup water.
Cover and bake for 25 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake 5 more minutes uncovered.

recipe.title: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
recipe.description: Omega-3 rich dinner with roasted vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Arrange asparagus and tomatoes on sheet.
Drizzle with 1 tbsp oil, salt, and pepper.
Place salmon on top of vegetables.
Brush salmon with remaining oil, garlic, and dill.
Top with lemon slices.
Bake for 15-18 minutes until salmon flakes.
Serve with wild rice.

recipe.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Stew
recipe.description: Hearty vegetarian stew with Mediterranean flavors
instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion for 3 minutes until softened.
Add eggplant and zucchini, cook 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and oregano.
Add tomatoes, chickpeas, and broth.
Bring to boil, then simmer 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

recipe.title: Lean Beef Stir-Fry
recipe.description: Quick Asian-inspired stir-fry with vegetables
instructions: Heat sesame oil in wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Remove beef and set aside.
Add vegetables, ginger, and garlic to pan.
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return beef to pan with soy sauce.
Toss everything together for 1 minute.
Serve over brown rice.

recipe.title: Herb-Crusted Pork Tenderloin
recipe.description: Lean pork with flavorful herb crust
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Mix herbs, garlic, mustard, and olive oil.
Rub mixture all over pork tenderloin.
Toss vegetables with oil, salt, and pepper.
Place pork on baking sheet with vegetables.
Roast for 20-25 minutes until pork reaches 145°F.
Let pork rest 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with roasted vegetables.

recipe.title: Turkey Meatloaf with Green Beans
recipe.description: Comfort food made healthier with lean turkey
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix turkey, oats, egg, onion, milk, and Worcestershire.
Form into loaf shape in baking dish.
Spread ketchup on top.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until cooked through.
Steam green beans for 5 minutes.
Let meatloaf rest 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with green beans.

recipe.title: Tofu Buddha Bowl with Peanut Sauce
recipe.description: Colorful vegan bowl with crispy tofu
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess water.
Heat sesame oil in skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu cubes until golden on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Steam edamame for 5 minutes.
Mix peanut butter, lime juice, soy sauce, and water for sauce.
Divide rice between bowls.
Arrange tofu, cabbage, edamame, and carrots on top.
Drizzle with peanut sauce.

recipe.title: Shrimp and Zucchini Noodles
recipe.description: Low-carb dinner with spiralized vegetables
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in large skillet.
Cook shrimp 2 minutes per side until pink.
Remove shrimp and set aside.
Add remaining oil and garlic, cook 30 seconds.
Add zucchini noodles and tomatoes.
Cook 3-4 minutes until noodles are tender.
Add wine and lemon juice.
Return shrimp to pan and toss.
Garnish with fresh basil.

recipe.title: Asian Glazed Meatballs with Broccoli
recipe.description: Flavorful meatballs with sweet and savory glaze
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Mix beef, breadcrumbs, egg, and half the garlic.
Form into 12 meatballs.
Bake meatballs for 15 minutes.
Steam broccoli for 5 minutes.
Mix soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, and remaining garlic.
Toss cooked meatballs in glaze.
Serve over rice with broccoli.

recipe.title: Baked Eggplant Parmesan
recipe.description: Lighter version of Italian classic
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Dip eggplant slices in egg, then breadcrumbs.
Place on baking sheet and spray with cooking spray.
Bake 20 minutes, flipping once.
In baking dish, layer sauce, eggplant, and cheeses.
Repeat layers.
Bake 15 minutes until cheese melts.
Serve over arugula tossed with olive oil.

recipe.title: Greek Yogurt with Berries
recipe.description: Protein-rich snack with antioxidants
instructions: Place yogurt in a small bowl.
Top with berries and chia seeds.
Enjoy immediately.

recipe.title: Chicken Fajita Bowl
recipe.description: Mexican-inspired bowl with seasoned chicken
instructions: Season chicken with fajita seasoning.
Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high.
Cook chicken 5-6 minutes until done.
Remove chicken and set aside.
Add peppers and onions to pan.
Cook 5 minutes until softened.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with chicken, vegetables, beans, yogurt, and salsa.

recipe.title: Hummus with Veggie Sticks
recipe.description: Crunchy vegetables with protein-packed dip
instructions: Place hummus in center of plate.
Arrange vegetables around hummus.
Use vegetables for dipping.

recipe.title: Cottage Cheese with Cucumber
recipe.description: Light and refreshing high-protein snack
instructions: Place cottage cheese in bowl.
Top with cucumber.
Sprinkle with dill and pepper.
Mix gently and enjoy.

recipe.title: Trail Mix Energy Bites
recipe.description: No-bake energy balls with nuts and dried fruit
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Chill mixture for 30 minutes.
Roll into 12 small balls.
Store in refrigerator.
Each serving is 2 balls.

recipe.title: Apple Slices with Almond Butter
recipe.description: Simple snack with fiber and healthy fats
instructions: Wash and slice apple.
Arrange on plate.
Serve with almond butter for dipping.
Sprinkle with cinnamon if desired.
